featured.text: These devices made it possible for doors to open by themselves and wine to flow magically out of statues’ mouths.
Some documents noted that Russians “indulge in excessive drinking whenever the occasion arises,” while others claimed that Russians “rarely drink wine.”
In these places people rest, get plenty of sleep, eat healthy food, drink water instead of wine, and exercise in various ways.
Before the adoption of Christianity in Russia (10th century), there were no vineyards and therefore no wine.
The Swiss military purchasers considered the new model with a corkscrew for opening wine not “essential for survival,” so officers had to buy this new model by themselves.

other.text: They made the statues in the temples drink wine as they wished.

definition.zh_def: 一種由葡萄或其他水果發酵而成的酒精飲料。
definition.en_def: An alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes or other fruits.
definition.example: She enjoys a glass of red wine with her dinner.
